name: Product Backlog
description: A prioritized list of everything that might be needed in the product and is the single source of requirements for any changes to be made to the product.
example: As a Product Owner, I want to have a clear list of features for my product, so that I can effectively communicate with stakeholders and development team.

name: Sprint
description: A time-boxed period of development during which a potentially releasable product increment is created.
example: In our two-week sprint, we aim to complete the user stories we've committed to, ensuring they meet our Definition of Done.

name: Daily Scrum
description: A 15-minute time-boxed event for the Development Team to synchronize activities and create a plan for the next 24 hours.
example: During our Daily Scrum, each team member shares what they accomplished yesterday, what they plan to do today, and any obstacles they're facing.

name: Product Owner
description: The person responsible for maximizing the value of the product and the work of the Development Team.
example: As a Product Owner, I work closely with stakeholders to understand their needs and prioritize the backlog to deliver maximum value.

name: Scrum Master
description: The servant-leader for the Scrum Team, responsible for ensuring that Scrum is understood and enacted.
example: As a Scrum Master, I facilitate Scrum events, remove impediments, and coach the team to improve continuously.

name: Sprint Planning
description: An event where the Scrum Team collaborates to define the work to be performed in the Sprint.
example: During Sprint Planning, the team reviews the Product Backlog, selects items for the Sprint Backlog, and creates a plan for the Sprint.

name: Sprint Review
description: An event where the Scrum Team and stakeholders review what was done in the Sprint and collaborate on what to do next.
example: In our Sprint Review, we demonstrate the completed work to stakeholders, gather feedback, and discuss any changes needed.

name: Sprint Retrospective
description: An event where the Scrum Team inspects itself and creates a plan for improvements to be enacted during the next Sprint.
example: During our Sprint Retrospective, we reflect on what went well, what could be improved, and commit to changes for the next Sprint.

name: Definition of Done
description: A shared understanding of what it means for work to be complete and potentially releasable.
example: Our Definition of Done includes passing all acceptance criteria, code review, automated tests, and documentation.

name: User Story
description: A short description of a feature told from the perspective of the person who desires the new capability.
example: As a user, I want to be able to log in with my email and password, so that I can access personalized features.
